de.iabg.mesh
Interface MeshConnectionReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
ASCIIMeshConnectionReader
public interface MeshConnectionReader

This interface declares basic functionality for parsing a file containing geometric connection data between two geometric models, namely node connections. In general, the user should call readFile() so that the parser reads and internally stores the data of the file. The data can then be safely parsed and extracted without having to stream file data multiple times.

Version:
September 11, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Method Summary
 void importNodeConnections(NodeConnectionMatrix connections)
          Clears the given node connections and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file.
 void readFile()
          Internally saves the data from the file for later use.
 

Method Detail

importNodeConnections

void importNodeConnections(NodeConnectionMatrix connections)
Clears the given node connections and replaces them with the data parsed from the internally stored file. This method should be called after readFile(), otherwise no data will be saved.

Parameters:
connections - the NodeConnectionMatrix where the data will be stored

readFile

void readFile()
              throws java.io.IOException
Internally saves the data from the file for later use. The format of the lines may be altered as required to more easily parse the file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file could not be read
